result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel L Virgil

records.addlTxt: Hearing on December 2, 2022 at 11:30 am.
ec: DA and Atty Huebner(10/17/22--ma)
Order for Competency Examination

[ma] Case called at 9:07 AM 
Defendant Daniel L Virgil in court.  Attorney Karl E Huebner in court for Daniel L Virgil.  Attorney Michael Witt in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Huebner has submitted a waiver of preliminary hearing form; after colloquy with Mr. Virgil, the Court is not satisfied that Mr. Virgil fully understands this waiver. 

ADA Witt indicates officer is present and State is capable of proceeding to preliminary hearing. 

Officer Kind-sworn & testifies
--direct examination by ADA Witt 

ADA Witt moves for bind over; no objection from Atty Huebner.

The Court finds probable cause that Mr. Virgil committed a felony. The Court binds him over for Trial.

The Court raises competency sua sponte. 

The Court directs Attorney Huebner to submit necessary order. 

recess: 9:21am  

NEXT:  Hearing on 12/2/22 at 11:30am (outcome of competency exam?/ at arraignment stage)
Scheduling Order

Pre-trial conference on September 21, 2022 at 11:40 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.

[ma] Case called at 1:46 PM 
Defendant Daniel L Virgil in court.  Attorney Karl E Huebner in court for Daniel L Virgil.  Attorney Melanie Flint in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.

recess: 1:48pm  

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on 9/21/22 at 11:40am   (2) Preliminary Hearing on 10/14/22 at 9:00am
Adjourned initial appearance on September 15, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

[ma] Case called at 1:36 PM 
Defendant Daniel L Virgil appeared by phone.  Attorney Karl E Huebner appeared by zoom for Daniel L Virgil.  Melanie Flint appeared by zoom for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Huebner requests for hearing to be rescheduled; Mr. Virgil's attempts to obtain transportation fell through. 

Atty Huebner appears in courtroom at 1:38pm 
recess: 1:39pm 
NEXT: Adjourned Initial Appearance on 9/15/22 at 1:15pm (must be in person, no zoom or telephone appearances)
Request to convert to Zoom
Adjourned initial appearance on August 18, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

[ma] Case called at 2:25 PM [Court Reporter: Linda Kasparzak]
Defendant Daniel L Virgil in court.  Attorney Melanie Flint in court for State of Wisconsin. 

The Court grants Mr. Virgil's petition for court appointed counsel; the Court orders repayment at the rate of $20 per month beginning 10/5/22, this repayment order may be re-addressed in the future, if needed. 

recess: 2:28pm 
NEXT: Adjourned Initial Appearance/ Status of Counsel on 8/18/22 at 1:15pm

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: State Public Defender Determination of Financial Eligibility - Defendant not eligible.
Adjourned initial appearance on August 4, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

[MK] case called at 1:18pm 
Defendant Daniel L Virgil appears in court, in custody, along with Public Defender Amber Rumpf (the PD appears for bond purposes only; at present he does not qualify for Public Defender representation). Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Rumpf verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
The Court toll  Preliminary Hearing time limits. [The Court adjourns the Initial Appearance.] 

The Court requires a $500 Signature Bond with conditions:
--no contact with Marco's Pizza in Watertown 
--no contact with Victim 1 as listed on the Victim Witness Key
recess 1:24pm. 

NEXT: Adjourned Initial Appearance (and status of counsel hearing) on August 4th at 1:45pm
